algorithm_technique: Calculate the slope between the first two points and check if all other points maintain the same slope.
problem_summary_simple: Verify if a set of 2D points lie on the same straight line.
problem_summary_technical: Check if the cross-product of vectors formed by consecutive points is zero.
key_insights: Points are collinear if the slope between any two pairs of points is the same.
To avoid division by zero (vertical lines), use the cross-product method: (y2 - y1) * (x3 - x2) == (y3 - y2) * (x2 - x1).

The provided solution uses a rearranged form of the cross-product for collinearity: `i[0] * j[1] - j[0] * i[1] + j[0] * k[1] - k[0] * j[1] + k[0] * i[1] - i[0] * k[1] == 0` which checks if points i, j, and k are collinear.
